details.description: A description of special aspects of the entity.

formula_weight.description: Formula mass in daltons of the entity.

pdbx_description.description:
A description of the entity.

 Corresponds to the compound name in the PDB format.

pdbx_number_of_molecules.description:
A place holder for the number of molecules of the entity in
 the entry.

rcsb_multiple_source_flag.description: A code indicating the entity has multiple biological sources.

rcsb_source_part_count.description: The number of biological sources for the entity.

src_method.description:
The method by which the sample for the entity was produced.
 Entities isolated directly from natural sources (tissues, soil
 samples etc.) are expected to have further information in the
 ENTITY_SRC_NAT category. Entities isolated from genetically
 manipulated sources are expected to have further information in
 the ENTITY_SRC_GEN category.

type.description:
Defines the type of the entity.

 Polymer entities are expected to have corresponding
 ENTITY_POLY and associated entries.

 Non-polymer entities are expected to have corresponding
 CHEM_COMP and associated entries.

 Water entities are not expected to have corresponding
 entries in the ENTITY category.

depth.description: Members of the enzyme classification lineage as parent classification hierarchy depth (1-N).

id.description: Members of the enzyme classification lineage as parent classification codes.

name.description: Members of the enzyme classification lineage as parent classification names.

provenance_code.description:
Combined list of macromolecular names associated provenance code.

 ECO (https://github.com/evidenceontology/evidenceontology)

provenance_source.description: Combined list of macromolecular names associated name source.

ec.description: Combined list of enzyme class assignments.

provenance_code.description:
Combined list of enzyme class associated provenance codes.

 ECO (https://github.com/evidenceontology/evidenceontology)

provenance_source.description: Combined list of enzyme class associated provenance sources.

name.description: A common name for the entity.
The systematic name for the entity.

nstd_linkage.description:
A flag to indicate whether the polymer contains at least
 one monomer-to-monomer link different from that implied by
 _entity_poly.type.

nstd_monomer.description:
A flag to indicate whether the polymer contains at least
 one monomer that is not considered standard.

examples:
A  for alanine or adenine
B  for ambiguous asparagine/aspartic-acid
R  for arginine
N  for asparagine
D  for aspartic-acid
C  for cysteine or cystine or cytosine
Q  for glutamine
E  for glutamic-acid
Z  for ambiguous glutamine/glutamic acid
G  for glycine or guanine
H  for histidine
I  for isoleucine
L  for leucine
K  for lysine
M  for methionine
F  for phenylalanine
P  for proline
S  for serine
T  for threonine or thymine
W  for tryptophan
Y  for tyrosine
V  for valine
U  for uracil
O  for water
X  for other
pdbx_seq_one_letter_code.description:
Chemical sequence expressed as string of one-letter
 amino acid codes. Modifications and non-standard
 amino acids are coded as X.

pdbx_seq_one_letter_code_can.description:
Cannonical chemical sequence expressed as string of
               one-letter amino acid codes. Modifications are coded
               as the parent amino acid where possible.

A  for alanine or adenine
B  for ambiguous asparagine/aspartic-acid
R  for arginine
N  for asparagine
D  for aspartic-acid
C  for cysteine or cystine or cytosine
Q  for glutamine
E  for glutamic-acid
Z  for ambiguous glutamine/glutamic acid
G  for glycine or guanine
H  for histidine
I  for isoleucine
L  for leucine
K  for lysine
M  for methionine
F  for phenylalanine
P  for proline
S  for serine
T  for threonine or thymine
W  for tryptophan
Y  for tyrosine
V  for valine
U  for uracil

pdbx_strand_id.description: The PDB strand/chain id(s) corresponding to this polymer entity.

pdbx_target_identifier.description: For Structural Genomics entries, the sequence's target identifier registered at the TargetTrack database.

rcsb_artifact_monomer_count.description:
Number of regions in the sample sequence identified as expression tags, linkers, or
 cloning artifacts.

rcsb_conflict_count.description: Number of monomer conflicts relative to the reference sequence.

rcsb_deletion_count.description: Number of monomer deletions relative to the reference sequence.

rcsb_insertion_count.description: Number of monomer insertions relative to the reference sequence.

rcsb_mutation_count.description: Number of engineered mutations engineered in the sample sequence.

rcsb_non_std_monomer_count.description: Number of non-standard monomers in the sample sequence.

items.description: Unique list of non-standard monomer chemical component identifiers in the sample sequence.

rcsb_prd_id.description: For polymer BIRD molecules the BIRD identifier for the entity.

rcsb_sample_sequence_length.description: The monomer length of the sample sequence.

expression_system_id.description:
A unique identifier for the expression system. This
 should be extracted from a local list of expression
 systems.

gene_src_common_name.description:
The common name of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained.

gene_src_details.description:
A description of special aspects of the natural organism from
 which the gene was obtained.

gene_src_genus.description:
The genus of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained.

gene_src_species.description:
The species of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained.

gene_src_strain.description:
The strain of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained, if relevant.

gene_src_tissue.description:
The tissue of the natural organism from which the gene was
 obtained.

gene_src_tissue_fraction.description:
The subcellular fraction of the tissue of the natural organism
 from which the gene was obtained.

host_org_common_name.description:
The common name of the organism that served as host for the
 production of the entity.  Where full details of the protein
 production are available it would be expected that this item
 be derived from _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_common_name
 or via _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_tax_id

host_org_details.description:
A description of special aspects of the organism that served as
 host for the production of the entity. Where full details of
 the protein production are available it would be expected that
 this item would derived from _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_details

host_org_genus.description:
The genus of the organism that served as host for the production
 of the entity.

host_org_species.description:
The species of the organism that served as host for the
 production of the entity.

pdbx_alt_source_flag.description:
This data item identifies cases in which an alternative source
 modeled.

pdbx_beg_seq_num.description:
The beginning polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding  
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

pdbx_description.description: Information on the source which is not given elsewhere.

pdbx_end_seq_num.description:
The ending polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding  
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

pdbx_gene_src_atcc.description: American Type Culture Collection tissue culture number.

pdbx_gene_src_cellular_location.description: Identifies the location inside (or outside) the cell.

pdbx_gene_src_fragment.description: A domain or fragment of the molecule.

pdbx_gene_src_ncbi_taxonomy_id.description:
NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the gene source organism.

 Reference:

 Wheeler DL, Chappey C, Lash AE, Leipe DD, Madden TL, Schuler GD,
 Tatusova TA, Rapp BA (2000). Database resources of the National
 Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan
 1;28(1):10-4 

 Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Rapp BA,
 Wheeler DL (2000). GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan 1;28(1):15-18.

pdbx_gene_src_organ.description: Organized group of tissues that carries on a specialized function.

examples:
ESCHERICHIA COLI
HOMO SAPIENS
SACCHAROMYCES CEREVISIAE

pdbx_host_org_atcc.description:
Americal Tissue Culture Collection of the expression system. Where
 full details of the protein production are available it would
 be expected that this item  would be derived from
 _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_culture_collection

pdbx_host_org_cell.description:
Cell type from which the gene is derived. Where
 entity.target_id is provided this should be derived from
 details of the target.

pdbx_host_org_cell_line.description:
A specific line of cells used as the expression system. Where
 full details of the protein production are available it would
 be expected that this item would be derived from
 entity_src_gen_express.host_org_cell_line

pdbx_host_org_cellular_location.description:
Identifies the location inside (or outside) the cell which
 expressed the molecule.

pdbx_host_org_culture_collection.description:
Culture collection of the expression system. Where
 full details of the protein production are available it would
 be expected that this item  would be derived somehwere, but
 exactly where is not clear.

pdbx_host_org_gene.description: Specific gene which expressed the molecule.

pdbx_host_org_ncbi_taxonomy_id.description:
NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the expression system organism.

 Reference:

 Wheeler DL, Chappey C, Lash AE, Leipe DD, Madden TL, Schuler GD,
 Tatusova TA, Rapp BA (2000). Database resources of the National
 Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan
 1;28(1):10-4 

 Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Rapp BA,
 Wheeler DL (2000). GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan 1;28(1):15-18.

pdbx_host_org_organ.description: Specific organ which expressed the molecule.

pdbx_host_org_organelle.description: Specific organelle which expressed the molecule.

pdbx_host_org_scientific_name.description:
The scientific name of the organism that served as host for the
 production of the entity. Where full details of the protein
 production are available it would be expected that this item
 would be derived from _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_scientific_name
 or via _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_tax_id

pdbx_host_org_strain.description:
The strain of the organism in which the entity was
expressed.

pdbx_host_org_tissue.description:
The specific tissue which expressed the molecule. Where full details
 of the protein production are available it would be expected that this
 item would be derived from _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_tissue

pdbx_host_org_tissue_fraction.description:
The fraction of the tissue which expressed the
molecule.

pdbx_host_org_variant.description:
Variant of the organism used as the expression system. Where
 full details of the protein production are available it would
 be expected that this item be derived from
 entity_src_gen_express.host_org_variant or via
 _entity_src_gen_express.host_org_tax_id

pdbx_host_org_vector.description:
Identifies the vector used. Where full details of the protein
 production are available it would be expected that this item
 would be derived from _entity_src_gen_clone.vector_name.

pdbx_host_org_vector_type.description:
Identifies the type of vector used (plasmid, virus, or cosmid).
 Where full details of the protein production are available it
 would be expected that this item would be derived from
 _entity_src_gen_express.vector_type.

pdbx_seq_type.description: This data item povides additional information about the sequence type.

plasmid_details.description:
A description of special aspects of the plasmid that produced the
 entity in the host organism. Where full details of the protein
 production are available it would be expected that this item
 would be derived from _pdbx_construct.details of the construct
 pointed to from _entity_src_gen_express.plasmid_id.

plasmid_name.description:
The name of the plasmid that produced the entity in the host
 organism. Where full details of the protein production are available
 it would be expected that this item would be derived from
 _pdbx_construct.name of the construct pointed to from
 _entity_src_gen_express.plasmid_id.

common_name.description:
The common name of the organism from which the entity
 was isolated.

details.description:
A description of special aspects of the organism from which the
 entity was isolated.

genus.description: The genus of the organism from which the entity was isolated.

pdbx_alt_source_flag.description:
This data item identifies cases in which an alternative source
 modeled.

pdbx_beg_seq_num.description:
The beginning polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding  
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

pdbx_cellular_location.description: Identifies the location inside (or outside) the cell.

pdbx_end_seq_num.description:
The ending polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding  
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

pdbx_fragment.description: A domain or fragment of the molecule.

pdbx_ncbi_taxonomy_id.description:
NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the source organism.

 Reference:

 Wheeler DL, Chappey C, Lash AE, Leipe DD, Madden TL, Schuler GD,
 Tatusova TA, Rapp BA (2000). Database resources of the National
 Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan
 1;28(1):10-4 

 Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Rapp BA,
 Wheeler DL (2000). GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan 1;28(1):15-18.

pdbx_organ.description: Organized group of tissues that carries on a specialized function.

pdbx_organism_scientific.description: Scientific name of the organism of the natural source.

pdbx_secretion.description: Identifies the secretion from which the molecule was isolated.

pdbx_src_id.description: This data item is an ordinal identifier for entity_src_nat data records.

species.description: The species of the organism from which the entity was isolated.

strain.description: The strain of the organism from which the entity was isolated.

tissue.description: The tissue of the organism from which the entity was isolated.

tissue_fraction.description:
The subcellular fraction of the tissue of the organism from
 which the entity was isolated.

comp_id.description: This data item is a pointer to _chem_comp.id in the CHEM_COMP category.

name.description: A name for the non-polymer entity

rcsb_prd_id.description: For non-polymer BIRD molecules the BIRD identifier for the entity.

examples: This sequence occurs naturally in humans.
details.description:
A description of special aspects of the source for the
 synthetic entity.

ncbi_taxonomy_id.description:
NCBI Taxonomy identifier of the organism from which the sequence of
 the synthetic entity was derived.

 Reference:

 Wheeler DL, Chappey C, Lash AE, Leipe DD, Madden TL, Schuler GD,
 Tatusova TA, Rapp BA (2000). Database resources of the National
 Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan
 1;28(1):10-4

 Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Rapp BA,
 Wheeler DL (2000). GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan 1;28(1):15-18.

organism_common_name.description:
The common name of the organism from which the sequence of
 the synthetic entity was derived.

organism_scientific.description:
The scientific name of the organism from which the sequence of
 the synthetic entity was derived.

pdbx_alt_source_flag.description:
This data item identifies cases in which an alternative source
 modeled.

pdbx_beg_seq_num.description:
The beginning polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding  
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

pdbx_end_seq_num.description:
The ending polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding  
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

asym_id.description: A reference to _struct_asym.id in the STRUCT_ASYM category.

instance_id.description:
The value of _pdbx_molecule.instance_id is identifies a particular molecule
	       in the molecule list.

prd_id.description:
The value of _pdbx_molecule.prd_id is the PDB accession code for this 
 reference molecule.

rcsb_comp_id.description: For non-polymer molecules the chemical component identifier for the BIRD instance.

rcsb_entity_id.description: The entity_id for the BIRD instance.

examples:
The drug binds to this enzyme in two roughly
                                  twofold symmetric modes. Hence this
                                  biological unit (3) is roughly twofold
                                  symmetric to biological unit (2). Disorder in
                                  the protein chain indicated with alternative
                                  ID 2 should be used with this biological unit.
details.description:
A description of special aspects of this portion of the contents
 of the deposited unit.

id.description:
The value of _pdbx_struct_entity_inst.id must uniquely identify a record in
 the PDBX_STRUCT_ENTITY_INST list.

 The entity instance is a method neutral identifier for the observed 
 molecular entities in the deposited coordinate set.

items.description: Instance identifiers corresponding to copies of the entity in this container.
Author instance identifiers corresponding to copies of the entity in this container.
Unique list of monomer chemical component identifiers in the entity in this container.
Non-polymer(ligand) chemical component identifier for the entity in this container.

prd_id.description: The BIRD identifier for the entity in this container.

provenance_source.description: Source of the related annotation assignment
Source of the reference database assignment

beg_seq_num.description:
The beginning polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding
 to this host organism.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

common_name.description: The common name of the host organism

end_seq_num.description:
The ending polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding
 to this host organism.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

items.description:
Common names associated with this taxonomy code obtained from NCBI Taxonomy Database.

  These names correspond to the taxonomy identifier assigned by the PDB depositor.

References:

Sayers EW, Barrett T, Benson DA, Bryant SH, Canese K, Chetvernin V,
Church DM, DiCuccio M, Edgar R, Federhen S, Feolo M, Geer LY,
Helmberg W, Kapustin Y, Landsman D, Lipman DJ, Madden TL, Maglott DR,
Miller V, Mizrachi I, Ostell J, Pruitt KD, Schuler GD, Sequeira E,
Sherry ST, Shumway M, Sirotkin K, Souvorov A, Starchenko G,
Tatusova TA, Wagner L, Yaschenko E, Ye J (2009). Database resources
of the National Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids
Res. 2009 Jan;37(Database issue):D5-15. Epub 2008 Oct 21.

Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Sayers EW (2009).
GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2009 Jan;37(Database issue):D26-31.
Epub 2008 Oct 21.

ncbi_parent_scientific_name.description:
The parent scientific name in the NCBI taxonomy hierarchy (depth=1) associated with this taxonomy code.

References:

Sayers EW, Barrett T, Benson DA, Bryant SH, Canese K, Chetvernin V,
Church DM, DiCuccio M, Edgar R, Federhen S, Feolo M, Geer LY,
Helmberg W, Kapustin Y, Landsman D, Lipman DJ, Madden TL, Maglott DR,
Miller V, Mizrachi I, Ostell J, Pruitt KD, Schuler GD, Sequeira E,
Sherry ST, Shumway M, Sirotkin K, Souvorov A, Starchenko G,
Tatusova TA, Wagner L, Yaschenko E, Ye J (2009). Database resources
of the National Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids
Res. 2009 Jan;37(Database issue):D5-15. Epub 2008 Oct 21.

Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Sayers EW (2009).
GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2009 Jan;37(Database issue):D26-31.
Epub 2008 Oct 21.

ncbi_scientific_name.description:
The scientific name associated with this taxonomy code aggregated by the NCBI Taxonomy Database.

  This name corresponds to the taxonomy identifier assigned by the PDB depositor.


References:

Sayers EW, Barrett T, Benson DA, Bryant SH, Canese K, Chetvernin V,
Church DM, DiCuccio M, Edgar R, Federhen S, Feolo M, Geer LY,
Helmberg W, Kapustin Y, Landsman D, Lipman DJ, Madden TL, Maglott DR,
Miller V, Mizrachi I, Ostell J, Pruitt KD, Schuler GD, Sequeira E,
Sherry ST, Shumway M, Sirotkin K, Souvorov A, Starchenko G,
Tatusova TA, Wagner L, Yaschenko E, Ye J (2009). Database resources
of the National Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids
Res. 2009 Jan;37(Database issue):D5-15. Epub 2008 Oct 21.

Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Sayers EW (2009).
GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2009 Jan;37(Database issue):D26-31.
Epub 2008 Oct 21.

ncbi_taxonomy_id.description:
NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the host organism.


 Reference:

 Wheeler DL, Chappey C, Lash AE, Leipe DD, Madden TL, Schuler GD,
 Tatusova TA, Rapp BA (2000). Database resources of the National
 Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan
 1;28(1):10-4

 Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Rapp BA,
 Wheeler DL (2000). GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan 1;28(1):15-18.

provenance_code.description: A code indicating the provenance of the host organism.

scientific_name.description: The scientific name of the host organism

depth.description: Members of the NCBI Taxonomy lineage as parent taxonomy lineage depth (1-N)

id.description: Members of the NCBI Taxonomy lineage as parent taxonomy idcodes.

name.description: Members of the NCBI Taxonomy lineage as parent taxonomy names.

chem_comp_count.description: The number of the particular chemical components in the polymer entity.

chem_comp_polymer_fraction.description: The fractional composition of the monomer in the polymer entity sequence.

comp_id.description: The component identifier for the monomer in the polymer sequence.

is_modified.description: Flag to indicate a non-standard monomer.

beg_seq_num.description:
The beginning polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

common_name.description: The common name for the source organism assigned by the PDB depositor.

end_seq_num.description:
The ending polymer sequence position for the polymer section corresponding
 to this source.

 A reference to the sequence position in the entity_poly category.

Common names associated with this taxonomy code aggregated by the NCBI Taxonomy Database.

  These name correspond to the taxonomy identifier assigned by the PDB depositor.

ncbi_parent_scientific_name.description:
The parent scientific name in the NCBI taxonomy hierarchy (depth=1) of the source organism assigned by the PDB depositor.

The scientific name associated with this taxonomy code aggregated by the NCBI Taxonomy Database.

  This name corresponds to the taxonomy identifier assigned by the PDB depositor.


References:

ncbi_taxonomy_id.description:
NCBI Taxonomy identifier for the gene source organism assigned by the PDB depositor.

 Reference:

 Wheeler DL, Chappey C, Lash AE, Leipe DD, Madden TL, Schuler GD,
 Tatusova TA, Rapp BA (2000). Database resources of the National
 Center for Biotechnology Information. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan
 1;28(1):10-4

 Benson DA, Karsch-Mizrachi I, Lipman DJ, Ostell J, Rapp BA,
 Wheeler DL (2000). GenBank. Nucleic Acids Res 2000 Jan 1;28(1):15-18.

provenance_code.description: A code indicating the provenance of the source organism details for the entity

scientific_name.description: The scientific name of the source organism assigned by the PDB depositor.

source_type.description: The source type for the entity

depth.description: Members of the NCBI Taxonomy lineage as parent taxonomy lineage depth (1-N)

id.description: Members of the NCBI Taxonomy lineage as parent taxonomy idcodes.

name.description: Memebers of the NCBI Taxonomy lineage as parent taxonomy names.

provenance_code.description:
Code identifying the individual, organization or program that
 assigned the reference sequence.

entity_beg_seq_id.description: An identifier for the monomer in the entity sequence at which this segment of the alignment begins.

length.description: An length of the this segment of the alignment.

ref_beg_seq_id.description: An identifier for the monomer in the reference sequence at which this segment of the alignment begins.

assignment_version.description: Identifies the version of the feature assignment.

items.description: Members of the feature class lineage as parent lineage depth (1-N)
Members of the feature class lineage as parent class identifiers.
Members of the feature class lineage as parent class names.

provenance_code.description:
Code identifying the individual, organization or program that
 assigned the feature.

reference_scheme.description: Code residue coordinate system for the assigned feature.

type.description: A type or category of the feature.

beg_seq_id.description: An identifier for the monomer at which this segment of the feature begins.

end_seq_id.description: An identifier for the monomer at which this segment of the feature ends.

comp_id.description: An identifier for the monomer(s) corresponding to the feature assignment.

seq_id.description: An identifier for the monomer at which this segment of the feature ends.

coverage.description: The fractional feature coverage relative to the full entity sequence.

type.description: Type or category of the feature.

title: schema: pdbx_core collection: pdbx_core_entity version: 6.1.0
description: RCSB Exchange Database JSON schema derived from the pdbx_core content type schema. This schema supports collection pdbx_core_entity version 6.1.0. This schema is hosted in repository https://github.com/rcsb/py-rcsb.db/tree/master/rcsb.db/data/json-schema/json-schema-min-pdbx_core_entity.json and follows JSON schema specification version 4
